nav.images: Load and enhance image volumes (ND2, TIFF, MAT, NPY, DICOM)
nav.mask: Define region-of-interest masks to exclude areas from tracking
nav.detection: Preview and tune particle detection parameters
nav.parameters: Configure tracking solver, matching, and trajectory parameters
nav.analysis: Run the full tracking analysis with live progress
nav.postprocess: Compute displacement, velocity, and strain fields from tracking results
nav.stress: Convert strain fields to stress using constitutive models
nav.plots: Generate publication-quality plots and export figures

images_page.btn_load_files: Open a file dialog to select individual image files (ND2, TIFF, MAT, NPY, DICOM)
images_page.btn_load_folder: Load all supported images from a folder as a time series
images_page.method_combo: Select an image enhancement method to add to the processing pipeline
images_page.btn_add_step: Add the selected enhancement method with current parameters to the pipeline
images_page.btn_remove_step: Remove the currently selected step from the enhancement pipeline
images_page.btn_clear_pipeline: Remove all steps from the enhancement pipeline
images_page.btn_run_enhance: Apply the enhancement pipeline to all loaded volumes
images_page.btn_revert: Discard enhancements and revert to original loaded images
images_page.z_slider: Navigate through Z-slices of 3D volume data
images_page.t_slider: Navigate through time points in the image series

mask_page.mask_type: Choose how to define the mask: rectangular ROI, polygon, or threshold-based
mask_page.x_from: Starting X coordinate of the rectangular ROI (pixels)
mask_page.x_to: Ending X coordinate of the rectangular ROI (pixels)
mask_page.y_from: Starting Y coordinate of the rectangular ROI (pixels)
mask_page.y_to: Ending Y coordinate of the rectangular ROI (pixels)
mask_page.z_from: Starting Z slice of the rectangular ROI (for 3D data)
mask_page.z_to: Ending Z slice of the rectangular ROI (for 3D data)
mask_page.btn_clear_mask: Reset the mask to include the full image

detection_page.method: Detection algorithm: TracTrac uses LoG blobs, TPT uses radial symmetry
detection_page.threshold: Intensity threshold for particle detection (0–1 normalized). Lower = more detections
detection_page.bead_radius: Expected particle radius in pixels. Affects sub-pixel localization
detection_page.min_size: Minimum blob size in pixels to accept as a particle
detection_page.max_size: Maximum blob size in pixels. Larger blobs are rejected as aggregates
detection_page.color: Particle brightness: 'white' for bright particles on dark background
detection_page.btn_detect: Run detection on the currently displayed frame to preview results
detection_page.btn_detect_all: Run detection on all frames (useful for checking consistency)

parameters_page.mode: Tracking mode: Incremental (frame-to-frame), Cumulative (all-to-reference), or Double Frame
parameters_page.f_o_s: Field of search radius in pixels. Limits max displacement per frame
parameters_page.n_neighbors_max: Maximum neighbors for topology matching. More = slower but more robust
parameters_page.n_neighbors_min: Minimum neighbors required for a valid topology match
parameters_page.loc_solver: Local matching method: Topology-based or Histogram-then-Topology
parameters_page.smoothness: Regularization smoothness parameter. Higher = smoother displacement field
parameters_page.outlier_threshold: Westerweel universal outlier test threshold. Lower = stricter filtering
parameters_page.strain_n_neighbors: Number of neighbors for strain gauge computation
parameters_page.strain_f_o_s: Field of search for strain neighbor identification
parameters_page.use_prev_results: Initialize from previous frame results for faster convergence
parameters_page.dist_missing: Distance threshold for marking particles as missing between frames
parameters_page.xstep: Physical pixel size in X direction (µm/pixel)
parameters_page.ystep: Physical pixel size in Y direction (µm/pixel)
parameters_page.zstep: Physical pixel size in Z direction (µm/pixel)
parameters_page.traj_dist_threshold: Distance threshold for merging broken trajectory segments (pixels)
parameters_page.traj_extrap_method: Extrapolation method for trajectory merging: 'pchip' (smooth) or 'nearest' (Brownian)
parameters_page.traj_min_segment: Minimum trajectory segment length to attempt merging (frames)
parameters_page.traj_max_gap: Maximum frame gap allowed when connecting trajectory segments
parameters_page.traj_merge_passes: Number of trajectory merge passes (more = more segments connected)

analysis_page.btn_run: Start the tracking analysis using current images, detection, and parameter settings
analysis_page.btn_cancel: Cancel the running analysis (results computed so far are kept)
analysis_page.cb_concurrent_pp: Run post-processing as tracking data becomes available (experimental)

postprocess_page.grid_step: Grid spacing for scatter-to-grid interpolation (pixels). Smaller = finer but noisier
postprocess_page.smoothness: Regularization smoothness for gridding. Higher values produce smoother fields
postprocess_page.xstep: Physical X pixel size (µm/px) for velocity computation
postprocess_page.ystep: Physical Y pixel size (µm/px) for velocity computation
postprocess_page.zstep: Physical Z pixel size (µm/px) for velocity computation
postprocess_page.tstep: Time step between frames (seconds) for velocity computation
postprocess_page.max_disp_threshold: Maximum displacement threshold (px). Larger displacements removed as outliers
postprocess_page.max_velocity_threshold: Maximum velocity threshold (µm/s). Larger velocities are flagged
postprocess_page.cb_strain: Compute and output infinitesimal strain tensor fields
postprocess_page.cb_def_grad: Compute and output deformation gradient tensor F
postprocess_page.btn_run: Run post-processing on tracking results to compute fields
postprocess_page.cb_view: Select which field component to display

stress_page.cb_model: Constitutive model: Linear Elastic, Neo-Hookean, or Mooney-Rivlin
stress_page.youngs_modulus: Young's modulus E in Pa (e.g., ~1000 for soft hydrogels, ~200e9 for steel)
stress_page.poisson_ratio: Poisson's ratio ν (typically 0.3–0.5; use ~0.45–0.5 for nearly incompressible materials)
stress_page.shear_modulus: Shear modulus μ = E/(2(1+ν)). Initial shear modulus for hyperelastic models
stress_page.bulk_modulus: Bulk modulus κ = E/(3(1-2ν)). Resistance to volumetric change
stress_page.C10: First Mooney-Rivlin constant (≈ μ/2 for consistency with neo-Hookean)
stress_page.C01: Second Mooney-Rivlin constant. Set to 0 to reduce to neo-Hookean model
stress_page.btn_load_mat: Load material properties from a JSON file
stress_page.btn_save_mat: Save current material properties to a JSON file for reuse
stress_page.btn_fill: Fill the anisotropic stiffness matrix from current E and ν values
stress_page.btn_run: Compute stress from post-processed strain data using selected constitutive model
stress_page.sb_frame: Select which frame to preview stress results
stress_page.cb_view: Select stress component or Von Mises equivalent to display

plots_page.cb_source: Data source for plotting: displacement, velocity, strain, stress, or trajectories
plots_page.cb_component: Component or projection to display from the selected data source
plots_page.sl_z: Z-slice index for 3D datasets. Drag to navigate through depth
plots_page.cb_plot_type: Plot rendering type: heatmap, contour, quiver/vector overlay
plots_page.sb_quiver_skip: Quiver density: show every Nth vector. Higher = sparser vectors
plots_page.dsb_quiver_scale: Vector length scaling factor. Larger = shorter vectors on screen
plots_page.sb_contour_levels: Number of contour levels for contour plots
plots_page.cb_cmap_cat: Colormap category: Sequential, Diverging, or Perceptual
plots_page.cb_cmap: Specific colormap within the selected category
plots_page.chk_auto_range: Automatically compute colorbar range from data (2nd–98th percentile)
plots_page.dsb_vmin: Manual minimum value for colorbar range (when auto range is off)
plots_page.dsb_vmax: Manual maximum value for colorbar range (when auto range is off)
plots_page.le_title: Custom plot title. Leave empty for auto-generated title
plots_page.le_cbar_label: Colorbar label text. Leave empty for auto label
plots_page.chk_grid: Show grid lines on the plot
plots_page.sb_dpi: Export resolution in dots per inch. 300 DPI for print quality
plots_page.cb_format: Export file format: PNG, SVG, PDF, TIFF, or EPS
plots_page.btn_export: Export the current plot view to a file
plots_page.btn_export_all: Export the current view for every frame to a folder
plots_page.btn_refresh: Refresh the plot with current settings
plots_page.sb_font_size: Font size for axis labels and titles
plots_page.cb_font_family: Font family for text in plots

experiments.btn_new: Create a new experiment. Each experiment has its own settings and results
experiments.btn_save: Save all experiments to a session file (.stk) for later recall
experiments.btn_load: Load a previously saved session file to resume work
experiments.list: Click an experiment to switch to it. Right-click for rename/duplicate/delete
